question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Simplify $\cos 54^\circ \cos 4^\circ - \cos 36^\circ \cos 86^\circ.$

Enter your answer is a trigonometric function evaluated at an integer, such as "sin 7".  (The system will assume that the angle is in degrees.)
inference:
$\cos 54^\circ \cos 4^\circ - \cos 36^\circ \cos 86^\circ$

$= \frac{1}{2} ( \cos (54^\circ + 4^\circ) + \cos (54^\circ - 4^\circ) ) - \frac{1}{2} ( \cos (36^\circ + 86^\circ) + \cos (36^\circ - 86^\circ) )$

$= \frac{1}{2} ( \cos 58^\circ + \cos 50^\circ ) - \frac{1}{2} ( \cos 122^\circ + \cos (-50^\circ) )$

$= \frac{1}{2} ( \cos 58^\circ + \cos 50^\circ ) - \frac{1}{2} ( \cos 122^\circ + \cos 50^\circ )$

$= \frac{1}{2} ( \cos 58^\circ - \cos 122^\circ )$

$= \frac{1}{2} ( 2 \sin 90^\circ \sin 32^\circ )$

$= \sin 32^\circ$

Final Answer: $\boxed{\sin 32^\circ}$. I hope it is correct.

question:
$\cos 54^\circ \cos 4^\circ - \cos 36^\circ \cos 86^\circ$

$= \frac{1}{2} ( \cos (54^\circ + 4^\circ) + \cos (54^\circ - 4^\circ) ) - \frac{1}{2} ( \cos (36^\circ + 86^\circ) + \cos (36^\circ - 86^\circ) )$

$= \frac{1}{2} ( \cos 58^\circ + \cos 50^\circ ) - \frac{1}{2} ( \cos 122^\circ + \cos (-50^\circ) )$

$= \frac{1}{2} ( \cos 58^\circ + \cos 50^\circ ) - \frac{1}{2} ( \cos 122^\circ + \cos 50^\circ )$

$= \frac{1}{2} ( \cos 58^\circ - \cos 122^\circ )$

$= \frac{1}{2} ( 2 \sin 90^\circ \sin 32^\circ )$

$= \sin 32^\circ$

Final Answer: $\boxed{\sin 32^\circ}$. I hope it is correct.
